paraphrase: Count the number of cities.
data.question: How many cities do we have?
sql: SELECT count(*) FROM City

paraphrase: What are all the distinct states?
data.question: List all states.
sql: SELECT DISTINCT state FROM City

paraphrase: Count the number of coutries.
data.question: How many countries do we have?
sql: SELECT count(DISTINCT country) FROM City

paraphrase: What are the names, codes, states, and countries for all cities?
data.question: Show names, codes, states, countries for all cities.
sql: SELECT city_name ,  city_code ,  state ,  country FROM City

paraphrase: What latitude and longitude correspond to Baltimore?
data.question: What is the latitude and longitude for Baltimore?
sql: SELECT latitude ,  longitude FROM City WHERE city_name  =  "Baltimore"

paraphrase: What are the names of all cities in PA?
data.question: Show names for all cities in state PA.
sql: SELECT city_name FROM City WHERE state  =  "PA"

paraphrase: Count the number of cities in Canada.
data.question: How many cities are in Canada?
sql: SELECT count(*) FROM City WHERE country  =  "CANADA"

paraphrase: What are all the city names for cities in the USA, ordered by latitude?
data.question: Show names for all USA city ordered by latitude.
sql: SELECT city_name FROM City WHERE country  =  "USA" ORDER BY latitude

paraphrase: How many cities are in each state?
data.question: Show all states and number of cities in each state.
sql: SELECT state ,  count(*) FROM City GROUP BY state

paraphrase: How many cities are there in each country?
data.question: Show all countries and number of cities in each state.
sql: SELECT country ,  count(*) FROM City GROUP BY country

paraphrase: Which states have at least two cities?
data.question: List all states with at least two cities.
sql: SELECT state FROM City GROUP BY state HAVING count(*)  >=  2

paraphrase: Give the state that has the most cities.
data.question: Which state has most number of cities?
sql: SELECT state FROM City GROUP BY state ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

paraphrase: Give the country with the fewest number of cities.
data.question: Which country has fewest number of cities?
sql: SELECT country FROM City GROUP BY country ORDER BY count(*) ASC LIMIT 1

paraphrase: What are the full names of students living in MD?
data.question: Show the first name and the last name for students living in state MD.
sql: SELECT T2.Fname ,  T2.Lname FROM City AS T1 JOIN Student AS T2 ON T1.city_code  =  T2.city_code WHERE T1.state  =  "MD"

paraphrase: Count the number of students living in China.
data.question: How many students live in China?
sql: SELECT count(*) FROM City AS T1 JOIN Student AS T2 ON T1.city_code  =  T2.city_code WHERE T1.country  =  "CHINA"

paraphrase: What are the first names and majors of students living in Baltimore?
data.question: Return the first name and major of students are living in Baltimore?
sql: SELECT T2.Fname ,  T2.Major FROM City AS T1 JOIN Student AS T2 ON T1.city_code  =  T2.city_code WHERE T1.city_name  =  "Baltimore"

paraphrase: How many students live in each country?
data.question: Show the number of students living in each country.
sql: SELECT T1.country ,  count(*) FROM City AS T1 JOIN Student AS T2 ON T1.city_code  =  T2.city_code GROUP BY T1.country

paraphrase: How many students live in each city?
data.question: Find the number of students living in each city.
sql: SELECT T1.city_name ,  count(*) FROM City AS T1 JOIN Student AS T2 ON T1.city_code  =  T2.city_code GROUP BY T1.city_code

paraphrase: Give the state that has the most students.
data.question: Which state has most number of students?
sql: SELECT T1.state FROM City AS T1 JOIN Student AS T2 ON T1.city_code  =  T2.city_code GROUP BY T1.state ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

paraphrase: Give the country with the fewest students.
data.question: Which country has least number of students?
sql: SELECT T1.country FROM City AS T1 JOIN Student AS T2 ON T1.city_code  =  T2.city_code GROUP BY T1.country ORDER BY count(*) LIMIT 1

paraphrase: What are the names of cities with at least three students?
data.question: Show names for all cities where at least three students live.
sql: SELECT T1.city_name FROM City AS T1 JOIN Student AS T2 ON T1.city_code  =  T2.city_code GROUP BY T1.city_code HAVING count(*)  >=  3

paraphrase: What are the states with more than 5 students?
data.question: Show all states where more than 5 students live.
sql: SELECT T1.state FROM City AS T1 JOIN Student AS T2 ON T1.city_code  =  T2.city_code GROUP BY T1.state HAVING count(*)  >  5

paraphrase: What the the student ids for students not living in the USA?
data.question: Show ids for all students who don't live in USA.
sql: SELECT StuID FROM Student EXCEPT SELECT StuID FROM City AS T1 JOIN Student AS T2 ON T1.city_code  =  T2.city_code WHERE country  =  "USA"

paraphrase: What are the student ids for female students in the state of PA?
data.question: Show ids for all female (sex is F) students living in state PA.
sql: SELECT StuID FROM City AS T1 JOIN Student AS T2 ON T1.city_code  =  T2.city_code WHERE T1.state  =  "PA"  AND T2.sex  =  'F'

paraphrase: What are the ids for male students not in the USA?
data.question: Show ids for all male students living outside of USA.
sql: SELECT StuID FROM City AS T1 JOIN Student AS T2 ON T1.city_code  =  T2.city_code WHERE T2.sex  =  'M' AND T1.country ! =  "USA"

paraphrase: Give the distance between BAL and CHI?
data.question: What is the distance between BAL and CHI?
sql: SELECT distance FROM Direct_distance WHERE city1_code  =  "BAL" AND city2_code  =  "CHI"

paraphrase: What is the distance between Boston and Newark?
data.question: Show me the distance between Boston and Newark.
sql: SELECT distance FROM Direct_distance AS T1 JOIN City AS T2 ON T1.city1_code  =  T2.city_code JOIN City AS T3 ON T1.city2_code  =  T3.city_code WHERE T2.city_name  =  "Boston" AND T3.city_name  =  "Newark"

paraphrase: Give the average, minimum, and maximum distances between two cities.
data.question: What is the average, minimum, maximum distance between two cities?
sql: SELECT avg(distance) ,  min(distance) ,  max(distance) FROM Direct_distance

paraphrase: What are the city codes of the cities with the maximum distance?
data.question: Show me the city code of two cities with maximum distance.
sql: SELECT city1_code ,  city2_code FROM Direct_distance ORDER BY distance DESC LIMIT 1

paraphrase: What are the city codes of cities with distance greater than average?
data.question: Show me the city code of two cities with a distance greater than the average.
sql: SELECT city1_code ,  city2_code FROM Direct_distance WHERE distance  >  (SELECT avg(distance) FROM Direct_distance)

paraphrase: What are the city codes corresponding to cities with distances less than 1000?
data.question: Show me the city code of two cities with a distance less than 1000.
sql: SELECT city1_code ,  city2_code FROM Direct_distance WHERE distance  <  1000

paraphrase: What is the sum of distances between BAL and other cities?
data.question: What is the total distance between city BAL and all other cities.
sql: SELECT sum(distance) FROM Direct_distance WHERE city1_code  =  "BAL"

paraphrase: Give the average distance between Boston and other cities.
data.question: What is the average distance between Boston and all other cities.
sql: SELECT avg(distance) FROM Direct_distance AS T1 JOIN City AS T2 ON T1.city1_code  =  T2.city_code WHERE T2.city_name  =  "Boston"

paraphrase: Give the name of the nearest city to Chicago.
data.question: What is the name of the city closest to Chicago?
sql: SELECT T3.city_name FROM Direct_distance AS T1 JOIN City AS T2 ON T1.city1_code  =  T2.city_code JOIN City AS T3 ON T1.city2_code  =  T3.city_code WHERE T2.city_name  =  "Chicago" ORDER BY distance LIMIT 1

paraphrase: Give the city name of the city with greatest distance from Boston.
data.question: What is the name of the city furthest to Boston?
sql: SELECT T3.city_name FROM Direct_distance AS T1 JOIN City AS T2 ON T1.city1_code  =  T2.city_code JOIN City AS T3 ON T1.city2_code  =  T3.city_code WHERE T2.city_name  =  "Boston" ORDER BY distance DESC LIMIT 1

paraphrase: For each city, what is the the city code and sum of distances from each?
data.question: Show all city codes and the total distance to all other cities.
sql: SELECT city1_code ,  sum(distance) FROM Direct_distance GROUP BY city1_code

paraphrase: What are the city name and average distances from each city?
data.question: Show all city names and the average distance to all other cities.
sql: SELECT T2.city_name ,  avg(distance) FROM Direct_distance AS T1 JOIN City AS T2 ON T1.city1_code  =  T2.city_code GROUP BY T1.city1_code

paraphrase: What is the distance between the cities where Linda Smith and Tracy Kim live?
data.question: How far do Linda (first name) Smith (last name) and Tracy (first name) Kim (last name) live?
sql: SELECT distance FROM Direct_distance AS T1 JOIN Student AS T2 ON T1.city1_code  =  T2.city_code JOIN Student AS T3 ON T1.city2_code  =  T3.city_code WHERE T2.Fname  =  "Linda" AND T2.Lname  =  "Smith" AND T3.Fname  =  "Tracy" AND T3.Lname  =  "Kim"

paraphrase: What is the full name of the student who lives furthest from Linda Smith?
data.question: What is the first name and last name of the student living furthest to Linda Smith?
sql: SELECT T3.Fname ,  T3.Lname FROM Direct_distance AS T1 JOIN Student AS T2 ON T1.city1_code  =  T2.city_code JOIN Student AS T3 ON T1.city2_code  =  T3.city_code WHERE T2.Fname  =  "Linda" AND T2.Lname  =  "Smith" ORDER BY distance DESC LIMIT 1

paraphrase: Give the state that the student with first name Linda lives in.
data.question: Which state does the student whose first name is Linda live in?
sql: SELECT state FROM Student AS T1 JOIN City AS T2 ON T1.city_code  =  T2.city_code WHERE T1.Fname  =  "Linda"
